ЖОПА ПОЛНАЯ ПОТЕРЯЛ ВСЕХ ДРУЗЕЙ

Single: Cool Story

Co-op: ROBOT RUN !

P.S. SeedRun Super Metroid in 30 minutes = SpeedRun Portal 2 in 30 minutes 
Fakt 1

25 hours is quite much for a game that is bigger then the first one, but still short-ish. Okay there is co-op which makes it a bit longer. But co-op is not for everyone, so I won't include it that much.

To start with the co-op. It's short-ish but that way it survives. And it's well worked-out into the game. The whole thing is 'course on personal experience and what kind of people are in the lobby.

The puzzles are a bit harder then Portal. But just as in Portal once you see it, it's good fun. The addition of repulsion gel makes it very interesting. Without that the game would miss something.

The story is quite thick, unlike the first game. But not too thick to back-fire. There are a couple of twists, but you more or less can see them coming.

Also the community delivers from time to time solid stuff.

After this I would advise you to play Portal, Stories of Mel. As it is a great addition to Portal and Portal 2.

I truly believe this game will last for generations to come, a fate a vast majority games have failed to accomplish. Most games these days stay on top for a month or two then slowly decline in popularity, but Portal, however, is still the most famous game on Steam, and its been there for [u]8 years[/u], an accomplishment shared only by Minecraft (that game's not on Steam, but is still among the most popular games on other platforms).

I bought this game shortly after my graduation, and I was hesitant at first at the price tag of $10. Once I got to playing it though, I was definitely amazed at the work that went into this. For ten bucks, the quality of this game surpasses even those expensive console games. The most significant part in my opinion is the single-player story mode. There's a lot to laugh at in the dialogue (especially [spoiler]Cave Johnson's prerecorded messages[/spoiler]), some of the things that occur in the storyline (I really liked the [spoiler]part in the hotel room at the beginning[/spoiler]), and even just the small details laying around. And who can forget when [spoiler]GLaDOS becomes a potato[/spoiler] or [spoiler]Wheatley gets thrown into space[/spoiler]? And once you're done with the story mode, you can still play an expanding collection of player-made puzzles (it seems a lot of those must be using a third-party level editor as they have features not legitimately available in the game's level maker) or you can also try the multiplayer mode (if you have nobody to play with, the game will randomly choose someone who's also looking to play with someone).

Sure it's been abandoned by its developers, but this game's legacy is never going to die. It's made appearances in many indie games, including Minecraft (the achievement for making a cake), to Terraria (the moon lord drops a portal gun), to even Geometry Dash (one of the portals in the game has the same colors as Portal's portals), and even fan-made Flash games.

Игра от хороших людей (в прошлом). Одна из лучших игр на мой взгляд: головоломки, саундтрек, персонажи и сеттинг. Все проработано на огромном уровне и с огромной любовью к своему делу. Каждый обязан поиграть в этот шедевр, если вам он  и не понравится, то для таких как вы, всегда есть мультиплеер. Просто зовешь своего братюню и угарайте со смешных шуток (а также над самими собой). В общем, всем рекомендую! 10/10

What to say about this game. What began as a small guest game in The Orange Box, which, although it can be easily finished in three hours, exposes a potential never seen before. Chell couldn't disappear in such an abrupt way given the potential as a saga he had and, with so many shitty sequels being pulled out of the bag annually, we couldn't expect less from valve. What can you expect from a game that has a mute protagonist, an asshole but funny robot and of course the best t-sundere in anime? (this time it's back in the shape of a potato!). An incredible soundtrack, an atmosphere that makes your hair stand on end, a story that is not explicitly presented... wow. 

A puzzle game can be very, very fun if you find the secret to combining simple rules to learn and use challenges of increasing difficulty that are based on what you learned before. If any piece of the formula doesn't work, the result can be very bad: complicated games, bad control, blockages and therefore, quick abandonment. But valve, oh man, valve knows what he's doing.

If you like puzzles, black mesa, serial humor, science or potatoes, you should definitely try this work of art. 10/ 10 sorry 11/10
